Experiences


November 9th, 2015 - Washington DC

Presented at STEMconnector Higher Education Council Disruptive Innovation Conference at the National Press Club. TedTalk about Olin College. Click the image to read more!

Watch the video of our presentation!

September 2013-Present - Needham, MA

I am the liaison to many visitors who come to learn about Olin College’s unique approach to teaching engineering. As a liaison, I inform the visiting deans and professors about Olin’s academic structure and help them envision how to apply it in the context of their own programs. I bring visitors to different laboratories and classrooms on campus, explaining the structure and pedagogical method behind the coursework. In doing so, I influence the incorporation of project-based and hands-on learning into the education of students around the globe. Concurrently, I learn about other institutions’ challenges of incorporating new pedagogical models into existing programs and reforming an established system and culture.



September 2014-December 2015 - Needham, MA

As a course assistant for Computer Architecture at Olin, I worked with many students in tutorials, office hours and during class time. We encouraged in-class, team-based board work so that students apply the theories directly after learning them. This provided opportunity for peer-to-peer knowledge sharing and time to ask questions to the professor or to me.



Summer 2015 - Watertown, MA

Developed a mobile application to be used by hospitals and doctor’s offices for patient check-in using JavaScript, Perl, PHP, Less, and Mustache.



Summer 2014 - Redmond, WA

Experienced all three disciplines of software engineering (Program Management, Development, Testing) while designing and developing a Windows Phone Application in JavaScript/HTML/CSS.



August 2013-March 2014 - Valley Forge, PA

Worked in IS&GS Defense under Advanced Programs. Researched machine learning and its applications.



Summer 2013 - Haifa, Israel

Worked on computer vision and recognition for a tech startup in Haifa, Israel, overcoming language barriers and cultural expectations.
